text: if you have a basement these crickets
are probably down there they're called
spider crickets or camel crickets and
they're an invasive species but boy can
they jump you could try to get rid of
them or you could use a high-speed video
camera to figure out how these crickets
can leap 50 to 60 times their body
length and land on their feet
researchers at Johns Hopkins took the
second pet they recruited students who
spent several months coaxing these
crickets to jump they found that the
crickets perform what looked like ballet
moves with their legs in antenna first
they streamline themselves then they
angle their body so that when they land
it will be on their powerful hind legs
like a jet landing on a runway insect
movements can always provide clues for
new robotic designs but what may be a
lot more important is looking closely at
a basement pest and finding beauty
you
Oh
